tasks.task: Responding to agricultural runoff's impact on water quality and species migration through conservation practices.
subtasks: Restore drained wetlands for species habitat.
Establish riparian buffers and filter strips.
Plant native grasses and forbs for wildlife corridors.
Use cover crops and reduced tillage to retain nutrients.
Implement rotational grazing to reduce soil erosion.
Create continuous crop rotations with nitrogen-fixing legumes.
Construct and maintain prairie strips to improve water quality.
Participate in public-private partnerships for ecosystem management.
Monitor local water bodies for pollution reduction.
Educate neighboring landowners on best management practices.

tasks.task: Addressing hypoxia in the Gulf of Mexico and corridor conservation.
subtasks: Conserve prairie potholes and tallgrass prairies for water filtration.
Utilize historical ecological knowledge in land management.
Align farming practices with historical landscape processes.
Leverage conservation easements to protect prioritized areas.
Rehabilitate stream and river channels for floodplain function.
Integrate geologic understanding into drainage management.
Protect and restore native prairie remnants as seed sources.
Incorporate habitat management for migratory species.
Adapt agricultural operations for dual economic and ecological benefits.
